## CES-D (Center for Epidemiological Studies-Depression) vs De Jong Gierveld Loneliness Scale

When comparing psychological instruments like the Center for Epidemiological Studies-Depression Scale (CES-D) and De Jong Gierveld Loneliness Scale, the process can be subjective and time-consuming.

{{< card heading="Try Harmony" copy="Compare CES_D and De Jong Gierveld Loneliness Scale " url="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app" >}}

However, software solution like Harmony can make the task far more efficient and analytical. Specifically designed to harmonise questionnaire items, Harmony utilises large language models to compare instruments and provides a percentage match between questionnaire items.


## Compare the items in CES_D English and De Jong Gierveld Loneliness Scale English

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import CES_D and De Jong Gierveld Loneliness Scale into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just CES_D into Harmony</a> - compare CES_D English with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just De Jong Gierveld Loneliness Scale into Harmony</a> - compare De Jong Gierveld Loneliness Scale English with other instruments
* [See CES-D in PDF](https://nida.nih.gov/sites/default/files/Mental_HealthV.pdf)

* [AUDIT-10 vs TFLB](/compare-harmonise-instruments/alcoholism/audit-10-vs-tflb)
* [CES-D vs PSS-10](/compare-harmonise-instruments/ces-d-vs-pss-10)
* [AQ-10 vs AQ-20](/compare-harmonise-instruments/autism/aq-10-vs-aq-20)



With CES-D focusing on symptoms related to depression, and the De Jong Gierveld Loneliness Scale measuring feelings of isolation and loneliness, Harmony's ability to find overlaps contributes to more comprehensive research.

Psychologists comparing CES-D vs De Jong Gierveld Loneliness Scale using Harmony will benefit from the software's capability to handle complex, multi-faceted scales, and produce accurate comparisons. Additionally, the drag-and-drop feature and the extensive database of instruments in Harmony's interface make the process even more seamless.



Harmony is a tremendous asset to psychologists harmonising and comparing psychological scales. Considerable potential lies in using this software to conduct meta-analyses of data gathered using both CES-D and De Jong Gierveld Loneliness Scale. Through Harmony, researchers can untangle the complex relationship between these two measures and contribute valuable insights to the field of psychology. By easing the process of comparison and harmonisation, Harmony enables deep, meaningful interpretations of questionnaire data.
